page.title: 01THE PILSLEY/TIBSHELF AREA
page.content:
The area covered by this survey is a part of North East Derbyshire including three villages, Pilsley, Morton and part of Tibshelf.
Apart from its residential use, the land is mainly agricultural, used largely for growing cereal crops or for pasture for dairy cattle.
The land is gently undulating in character. The underlying rock contains coal measures which have been exploited in the past, with coal mines in all three villages, open-cast mining and a small oil well.
The source of the River Rother can be found in the parish of Pilsley.
